intro: Phacelia sonoitensis, commonly known as the Sierra phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces seed pods that split open when mature. Phacelia sonoitensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
